An overview and explanation of the key concepts of FrameLib, such as its timing and patching architecture.
Beginner.Tutorial 3: Converting data between Fram: Methods for converting data between the Max and FrameLib domains.
An overview of the various 'generator' objects belonging to the FrameLib eco-system.
Beginner.Tutorial 5: Your first FrameLib project: A longer tutorial than the previous four that builds on previously covered information. Construct a granular synthesis engine from scratch and add increasingly complex features.

The Basics of FFT/STFT processing in FrameLib
A feature unique to FrameLib and somewhat similar to the Max 'mc' system, multi-streaming allows you to manipulate multiple streams of data at varying rates and sizes with only one set of processing objects.

An extension of the FFT tutorial, this crash course introduces you to the possibilities of multi-resolution FFT's.
